PEOPLE.PROFESSIONAL-ACCREDITATION-INFO: Accreditation is recognition by an independent professional organisation or non-governmental body that an entity or member has met certain standards (E.g. QCTO â€“ Quality Council for Trades and Occupations where Training Providers need to register as registered providers
PEOPLE.PROFESSIONAL-CERTIFICATION-INFO: Certification is a credential that a practitioner may seek in addition to their primary qualifying degree and examination. For example, a Psychologist, seeking certification in a specialty (e.g., Industrial Psychology) in addition to his or her Generic Degree. Certifications are generally administered by national boards that specify the education, training, competency, and examination requirements to achieve certification and re-certification. Certification may or may not be required as part of the licensure process. The Body associated with this example is: HPCSA (Health Professions Council of South Africa)
PEOPLE.PROFESSIONAL-LICENSING-INFO: Licensing is the formal recognition by a regulatory body that a practicing professional (E.g. Chartered Accountant) has successfully passed all the relevant qualifications to practice in that specific profession. Licensure requirements include a combination of education, training and examinations to demonstrate competency: E.g. SAICA (South African Institute of Chartered Accountants)
